alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 21 at 2:50AM MDT until April 21 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .West to northwest winds will strengthen again today with gusts of 40 to 45 mph expected, especially along the central mountains, and highlands, over the Northeast Highlands mainly south of Wagon Mound, and over the East Central Plains where very low humidity of 8 to 15 percent is expected. Minimal potential for critical conditions Saturday and Sunday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM MDT this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains (Zone 126) from noon today to 8 PM MDT this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts to near 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 8 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
